title: Simple Hunting Tools You Can Make
content: Spear: Sharpen a long stick with a knife or fire. Harden the point by lightly charring it in flame. Bow and Arrow: Use a flexible branch and string (cord, shoelace). Arrows can be made from straight sticks and sharpened tips. Slingshot: Use a Y-shaped branch and rubber tubing. Practice aiming. Traps: Build deadfalls (rock falls when stick is triggered) or snares (loops made from wire or string to catch small animals).
